title: Commending Sister M. Johanna DeLelys upon the occasion of her retirement as President and CEO of St. Elizabeth Medical Center
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  commending  Sister  M. Johanna DeLelys upon the
occasion of her retirement as President and CEO of St. Elizabeth Medical
Center on June 30, 2010

WHEREAS, The character and richness of religious and community  life  in
this noble Empire State are nourished and fulfilled through the faithful
concern  and  selfless devotion of those who would commit their energies
and purpose to the ministry of others; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body to bring full recog-
nition and just tribute to those individuals who distinguish  themselves
and the ministry through their unremitting commitment and preeminence of
service; and
  WHEREAS,  This  Legislative  Body is justly proud to commend Sister M.
Johanna DeLelys upon the occasion of her retirement as President and CEO
of St. Elizabeth Medical Center on June 30, 2010; and
  WHEREAS, Sister Johanna has worked at  St.  Elizabeth  since  1965  in
various  nursing and management positions; she was named Chief Operating
Officer in 1991 and served in this  position  until  she  was  appointed
President and CEO on January 1, 2004; and
  WHEREAS, A diplomate of the American College of Healthcare Executives,
Sister  Johanna  became  a  registered  nurse  after graduating from St.
Joseph's Hospital School of Nursing in Syracuse, New York; she  went  on
to earn a BS in Nursing at Catholic University of America in Washington,
and  an MBA in Hospital Administration from Xavier University in Cincin-
nati, Ohio; and
  WHEREAS, An exemplary leader, Sister Johanna guided the Medical Center
through many changes and advances; highlights  of  her  esteemed  career
include  serving  in  a  senior  leadership  post during creation of the
Mohawk Valley Heart Institute; leading St. Elizabeth  to  meet  the  ISO
9001  and  14001 criteria, establishing it as one of the most accredited
hospitals in the nation; renovating, expanding and the modernization  of
the Emergency Department and Kitchen/Cafeteria; renovation of the Cardi-
ac  Catheterization  Labs;  opening of a new state-of-the art Orthopedic
Unit featuring private patient rooms; and the  expansion  of  Outpatient
Services at St. Elizabeth's Medical Arts building; and
  WHEREAS,  In  addition,  Sister  Johanna  sits  on boards and advisory
committees for several local organizations; she  plans  to  continue  to
serve the needs of St. Elizabeth patients in the role of a Patient Advo-
cate; and
  WHEREAS,  Sister  Johanna  has brought to her ministry an overwhelming
spirit of charity and compassion, acting from vision  and  enlightenment
in  conducting  her  administrative  and  spiritual duties, while always
displaying the highest standards of personal and professional  integrity
and dedication; and
  WHEREAS,  This  distinguished  woman  of God has always given enlight-
enment, guidance and wisdom to the many entrusted to her  care  and  has
administered  abundantly  and unstintingly to the spiritual and corporal
needs of all; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body that when  a  person
of such noble aims and accomplishments is brought to our attention it is
appropriate  to  publicly and jubilantly proclaim and commend that indi-
vidual for the edification of others; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
commend Sister M. Johanna DeLelys upon the occasion of her retirement as
President  and  CEO  of  St.  Elizabeth Medical Center on June 30, 2010,
noting her unremitting and compassionate faith and her exemplary service
to God, man, and her community, and extending to her the heartfelt  best

wishes  of  this Legislative Body for a future of purposeful success and
well-being; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Sister M. Johanna DeLelys.
